title: Katrine Veje
text:
Katrine Vejsgaard Veje (born 19 June 1991) is a Danish <a href="Association%20football">football player</a> who plays as a <a href="midfielder%20%28association%20football%29">midfielder</a> for <a href="FC%20Roseng%C3%A5rd">FC Rosengård</a> in the Swedish <a href="Damallsvenskan">Damallsvenskan</a> and the <a href="Denmark%20women%27s%20national%20football%20team">Danish national team</a>. She has previously played for <a href="Arsenal%20W.F.C.">Arsenal</a> in the <a href="FA%20WSL">FA WSL</a>, <a href="FC%20Roseng%C3%A5rd">LdB FC Malmö</a> of Sweden's <a href="Damallsvenskan">Damallsvenskan</a>, <a href="Seattle%20Reign%20FC">Seattle Reign FC</a> of the <a href="National%20Women%27s%20Soccer%20League">National Women's Soccer League</a> as well as <a href="Odense%20Q">Odense Q</a> and <a href="Br%C3%B8ndby%20IF%20%28women%29">Brøndby IF</a> of Denmark's <a href="Elitedivisionen">Elitedivisionen</a>.
Club career.
In 2007, Veje was awarded the <a href="Danish%20Football%20Association">Danish Football Association</a>'s prize for Young Player of the Year.
Seattle Reign.
In January 2015, it was announced that Veje had signed with <a href="Seattle%20Reign%20FC">Seattle Reign FC</a> for the <a href="2015%20National%20Women%27s%20Soccer%20League%20season">third season</a> of the <a href="National%20Women%27s%20Soccer%20League">National Women's Soccer League</a> in the United States. Of her signing, Reign FC head coach <a href="Laura%20Harvey">Laura Harvey</a> said, "I have had my eye on Katrine for many years, having first seen her when I was an assistant coach with the U17 England squad...We believe she is capable of bringing something special to our club and to the NWSL." She made her first appearance for Seattle on 12 July 2015 against <a href="Portland%20Thorns%20FC">Portland</a>.
Brøndby IF.
In October 2015, Veje decided to return to Brøndby IF. With Brøndby IF, she won the Danish <a href="2016%E2%80%9317%20Elitedivisionen">league</a> and <a href="Danish%20Women%27s%20Cup">cup</a> in 2017.
Montpellier HSC.
In June 2017, it was announced that Veje had signed a two-year contract with the <a href="Division%201%20F%C3%A9minine">Division 1 Féminine</a> runners-up <a href="Montpellier%20HSC%20%28Women%29">Montpellier HSC</a>.
Arsenal.
In January 2019, it was announced that Veje had signed a contract with <a href="Arsenal%20W.F.C.">Arsenal</a>.
International career.
Veje debuted on the Danish national team in a <a href="Exhibition%20game">friendly</a> against <a href="England%20women%27s%20national%20football%20team">England</a> in 2009. She was named to national <a href="Coach%20%28sport%29">coach</a> <a href="Kenneth%20Heiner-M%C3%B8ller">Kenneth Heiner-Møller</a>'s <a href="Denmark%20women%27s%20national%20football%20team">Denmark</a> squad for <a href="UEFA%20Women%27s%20Euro%202013">UEFA Women's Euro 2013</a> as well as to <a href="Nils%20Nielsen">Nils Nielsen</a>'s <a href="UEFA%20Women%27s%20Euro%202017">UEFA Women's Euro 2017</a> squad.
